newsitem.title: CHINA: Shangdong Xinhua to issue 10 mln A-shares.
newsitem.headline: Shangdong Xinhua to issue 10 mln A-shares.

text.p: Shangdong Xinhua Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Wednesday it planned to raise 32.75 million yuan after expenses by issuing 10 million A-shares to fund its production of caffeine, nisoldpine and melatonin.
The medicine maker said the China Securities Regulatory Commission had granted final apporval for listing the A-shares and the listing prospectus would be published on Thursday.
The company said the A-shares would be issued at 3.45 yuan per share to public investors in China.

The 10 million new A-shares and another 2.5 million existing A-shares held by company employees will make up a total of 12.5 million A-shares or 2.9 percent of the company's enlarged share capital. The A-shares will be listed in Shenzhen.
A-shares are shares of Chinese enterprises listed in Shanghai and Shenzhen for domestic investors only.
Hubei Securities Co Ltd is the lead underwriter of the issue and sponsors are China Southern Securities Co Ltd, Shangdong International Trust & Investment Co Ltd and Hubei Securities.
The total number of H-shares will be unchanged at 150 million shares following the A-share issue, but their percentage of the company will be diluted to 35.1 percent from 35.9 percent.
H-shares are Chinese enterprises' shares listed in Hong Kong. Trading in the company H-shares is due to resume on Wednesday following a one-day suspension.
The company reported total sales revenue of 842.2 million yuan in 1996, up from 711.9 million yuan in 1995 and 533.7 million in 1994.
